alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rensselaer; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington, northeastern Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bennington, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Arlington, Salem, Manchester, Shaftsbury, Manchester Center, Hoosick, White Creek, North Bennington, Sunderland, Woodford, Sandgate, Old Bennington, Glastenbury, White Creek Station, Paper Mill Village, Sodom, Chiselville, East Hoosick and South Shaftsbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
